intro: Krameria spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed krameria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, commonly known as the cactus family, and is characterized by its succulent stems and spiny foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically broad and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native desert environment. Krameria spathulata is often found growing in rocky soils and is well-suited to harsh, sunny conditions.
